name: testing
description: End-to-end testing with Playwright for web applications - cross-browser testing and automation

examples.description: Test landing page functionality, navigation, and interactions

examples.name: Form Submission Test
examples.description: Test form validation, submission, and error handling

examples.name: Visual Regression Test
examples.description: Compare screenshots for visual changes across builds

guidelines: Write tests that are independent and can run in any order
Use Page Object Model (POM) pattern for better maintainability
Test across multiple browsers (Chromium, Firefox, WebKit/Safari)
Include mobile viewport testing for responsive designs
Use data-testid attributes for reliable element selection
Add visual regression tests for important pages
Mock external API calls for consistent testing
Use fixtures for test data setup and teardown
Generate and review HTML test reports
Implement proper wait strategies (avoid arbitrary sleeps)
Test error states and edge cases
Use tracing for debugging failed tests
best_practices: Organize tests by feature or page
Use descriptive test names that explain what is being tested
Keep tests focused on user behavior, not implementation
Parameterize tests for testing multiple scenarios
Use soft assertions for multiple checks in one test
Implement custom matchers for domain-specific assertions
Use network interception for testing loading states
Test keyboard navigation and screen reader compatibility
Run tests in parallel for faster execution
Use tags to organize and filter tests
Monitor test flakiness and fix unstable tests
